<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=WordSection1>

<p align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'>Course Syllabus<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:18.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p align=center style='text-align:center'><span class=SpellE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:blue'>CompSci</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;color:blue'>
131 - Parallel and Distributed Systems<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;color:blue'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Instructor</span></b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>: <span style='mso-tab-count:1'> </span>Prof. A.
Veidenbaum<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>TAs</span></b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>: <span style='mso-tab-count:2'>          </span>Claudio
Parra, <span class=SpellE>Aniket</span> <span class=SpellE>Shivam</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Office
Hours<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><u><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Instructor</span></u></i><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>:<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>   </span></span></b><span style='font-size:
14.0pt'>Immediately after each lecture or by appointment.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><u><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>TA</span></u></i><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>:<span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>             </span></span></b><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'> 9:00 - 10:00am, room 464C in ICS1 <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Prerequisites</span></b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>: </span><u style='text-underline:#042364'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;color:#042364'>ICS53</span></u><span
style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>+<u style='text-underline:
#042364'><span style='color:#042364'>53L</span></u> and (<u style='text-underline:
#042364'><span style='color:#042364'>ICS45C</span></u> or ICS 65 or equivalent)
</span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>         </span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='color:#3366FF'>Students who
started in the CS program before ICS53 was introduced<o:p></o:p></span></i></span></p>

<p><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;color:#3366FF'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>         </span>do
not need to take it to enroll in 131.<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt;color:#C0504D'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Textbook</span></b><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>: </span><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
Monaco'>"</span><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Distributed Algorithms</span><span
style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:Monaco'>"</span><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'> by Wan <span class=SpellE>Fokkink</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Secondary, <u>optional</u> textbook</span></i><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'> </span><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
Monaco'>"Distributed Systems" by Andrew <span class=SpellE>Tannenbaum</span>
and Maarten van Steen. 2nd edition</span><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>COURSE
OVERVIEW<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>This course is an introduction to parallel
and distributed systems and their programming. It examines major concepts
involved in creating parallel/distributed software and applications using a
collection of independent, communicating single-processor systems. Performance
issues in such systems are also covered.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Major topics covered in this course are:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Overview of parallel and distributed systems<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>OS support, networking <o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Parallel and Distributed programming and performance<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Deadlock and termination detection<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Election, Mutual exclusion, Barriers<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Consistency and replication<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt'>Consensus with failures and crashes<o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>The course is composed of three components:
lectures, homework assignments, and programming assignments. The objective of
the lectures is to introduce and help you understand the concepts.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The assignments aim to strengthen and
enhance your understanding. The assignments are based on lecture material <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>and</i> textbook readings. The focus of
programming assignments is to put the concepts to practice and perform actual
parallel/distributed programming. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:.5in'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>GRADING<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>There will be 6 assignments, a mid-term and a
final exam. <span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>All assignments
will be posted on the class web page and must be submitted electronically via
EEE. Assignments will consist of 3 labs and 3 homeworks. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Assignments
will be graded and need to be performed individually. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Lab
programs will be checked through MOSS. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>There
will be zero tolerance for cheating.</span></b><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Your grade in CompSci131 will be based on
your performance on assignments and the exams. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.25in'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The following approximate weights will
be used:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-indent:.25in'><span
style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Assignments -
40%<span class=GramE><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span>(</span>Individual
assignments will carry different weights depending on the degree of difficulty)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:.75in'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'>Exams - 60%<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='margin-left:.75in'><span style='font-size:14.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Late assignments will NOT be <span class=GramE>accepted <span
style='color:windowtext'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>(</span></span></span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>exceptions for illness, etc. must be made, <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>in writing, </b>as soon as possible and <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>before</b> the due date</span></i><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Assignment re-grade requests are only considered for a period of 1
week </span><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>following the date when the assignment scores
have been posted</span></i><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>. <span style='color:red'>You MUST write a cover sheet </span>explaining
why you believe a problem was <span class=SpellE>mis</span>-graded to have an
assignment re-graded. Return the assignment and the cover sheet to the TA.<span
style='color:red'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>
